member.name: T:DarkSky.Models.Alert
member.summary:
The alerts array contains objects representing the severe weather warnings issued for the requested location by a governmental authority (please see our
data sources page
for a list of sources).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.DateTime
member.summary: The time at which the alert was issued.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.Description
member.summary: A detailed description of the alert.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.ExpiresDateTime
member.summary: The time at which the alert will expire. (Some alerts sources, unfortunately, do not define expiration time, and in these cases this parameter will not be defined).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.Regions
member.summary: A of strings representing the names of the regions covered by this weather alert.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.Severity
member.summary: The severity of the weather alert. Will take one of the following values: "advisory" (an individual should be aware of potentially severe weather), "watch" (an individual should prepare for potentially severe weather), or "warning" (an individual should take immediate action to protect themselves and others from potentially severe weather).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.Title
member.summary: A brief description of the alert.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.Uri
member.summary: An HTTP(S) URI that one may refer to for detailed information about the alert.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.TimeZone
member.summary: TimeZone from the parent Forecast object.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.UnixExpires
member.summary: The UNIX time at which the alert will expire. (Some alerts sources, unfortunately, do not define expiration time, and in these cases this parameter will not be defined).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.Alert.UnixTime
member.summary: The UNIX time at which the alert was issued.

member.name: T:DarkSky.Models.DarkSkyResponse
member.summary: A wapper around the actual Dark Sky response as well as useful properties for interacting with the response.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DarkSkyResponse.AttributionLine
member.summary:
You agree that any application or service which incorporates data obtained from the Service shall prominently display the message in this property in a legible manner near the data or any information derived from any data from the Service.
This message must, if possible, open a link to when clicked or touched.
You may not display or invoke the Service or Dark Sky name or logo in any manner that implies a relationship or affiliation with, sponsorship, promotion, or endorsement by Dark Sky, except as authorized by these
Terms of Service
.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DarkSkyResponse.DataSource
member.summary: The link to use during data source attribution.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DarkSkyResponse.Headers
member.summary: The for the API request.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DarkSkyResponse.IsSuccessStatus
member.summary: The response from the Dark Sky API is a success status.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DarkSkyResponse.Response
member.summary: The API response.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DarkSkyResponse.ResponseReasonPhrase
member.summary: Dark Sky response ReasonPhrase.

member.name: T:DarkSky.Models.DataBlock
member.summary: A data block object represents the various weather phenomena occurring over a period of time.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataBlock.Data
member.summary: An List of , ordered by time, which together describe the weather conditions at the requested location over time.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataBlock.Icon
member.summary:
A machine-readable text summary of this data block.
(May take on the same values as the property of data points).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataBlock.Summary
member.summary: A human-readable summary of this data block.

member.name: T:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint
member.summary:
A data point object contains various properties, each representing the average (unless otherwise specified) of a particular weather phenomenon occurring during a period of time: an instant in the case of , a minute for
, an hour for , and a day for .

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperature
member.summary: The apparent (or “feels like”) temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureHigh
member.summary: The daytime high apparent temperature.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureHighDateTime
member.summary: The time of when occurs during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureLow
member.summary: The overnight low apparent temperature.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureLowDateTime
member.summary: The time of when occurs during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureMax
member.summary: The maximum value of during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureMaxDateTime
member.summary: The time of when occurs during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureMin
member.summary: The minimum value of during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.ApparentTemperatureMinDateTime
member.summary: The time of when occurs during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.CloudCover
member.summary: The percentage of sky occluded by clouds, between 0 and 1, inclusive.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.DateTime
member.summary: The time at which this data point begins. minutely data point are always aligned to the top of the minute, hourly data point objects to the top of the hour, and daily data point objects to midnight of the day, all according to the local time zone.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.DewPoint
member.summary: The dew point in degrees Fahrenheit.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.Humidity
member.summary: The relative humidity, between 0 and 1, inclusive.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.Icon
member.summary: A machine-readable text summary of this data point, suitable for selecting an icon for display.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.MoonPhase
member.summary:
The fractional part of the lunation number during the given day: a value of 0 corresponds to a new moon, 0.25 to a first quarter moon, 0.5 to a full moon, and 0.75 to a last quarter moon.
(The ranges in between these represent waxing crescent, waxing gibbous, waning gibbous, and waning crescent moons, respectively).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.NearestStormBearing
member.summary:
The approximate direction of the nearest storm in degrees, with true north at 0° and progressing clockwise.
(If is zero, then this value will not be defined).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.NearestStormDistance
member.summary:
The approximate distance to the nearest storm in miles.
(A storm distance of 0 doesn’t necessarily refer to a storm at the requested location, but rather a storm in the vicinity of that location).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.Ozone
member.summary: The columnar density of total atmospheric ozone at the given time in Dobson units.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.PrecipAccumulation
member.summary:
The amount of snowfall accumulation expected to occur, in inches.
(If no snowfall is expected, this property will not be defined).
member.remarks: optional, only on hourly and daily.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.PrecipIntensity
member.summary: The intensity (in inches of liquid water per hour) of precipitation occurring at the given time. This value is conditional on probability (that is, assuming any precipitation occurs at all) for minutely data points, and unconditional otherwise.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.PrecipIntensityError
member.summary: Undocumented, presumably was a value representing the potential error in the .

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.PrecipIntensityMax
member.summary: The maximum value of during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.PrecipIntensityMaxDateTime
member.summary: The time of when occurs during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.PrecipProbability
member.summary: The probability of precipitation occurring, between 0 and 1, inclusive.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.PrecipType
member.summary:
The type of precipitation occurring at the given time.
(If precipIntensity is zero, then this property will not be defined).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.Pressure
member.summary: The sea-level air pressure in millibars.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.Summary
member.summary:
A human-readable text summary of this data point.
(This property has millions of possible values, so don’t use it for automated purposes: use the property, instead!).

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.SunriseDateTime
member.summary: The time of when the sun will rise during a given day.

member.summary: The time of when the sun will set during a given day.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.DataPoint.Temperature
member.summary: The air temperature in degrees Fahrenheit.

member.summary: The daytime high temperature.

member.summary: The time of when occurs during a given day.

member.summary: The overnight low temperature.

member.summary: The time of when occurs during a given day.

member.summary: The maximum value of during a given day.

member.name: T:DarkSky.Models.OptionalParameters
member.summary: Optional parameters that an be used to modify the API request.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.OptionalParameters.DataBlocksToExclude
member.summary: A List of that prevent specific properties from being populated from the API.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.OptionalParameters.ExtendHourly
member.summary:
When present, return hour-by-hour data for the next 168 hours, instead of the next 48.
When using this option, we strongly recommend enabling HTTP compression.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.OptionalParameters.ForecastDateTime
member.summary:
A Time Machine Request returns the observed (in the past) or forecasted (in the future) hour-by-hour weather and daily weather conditions for a particular date.
A Time Machine request is identical in structure to a , except:
The currently data point will refer to the time provided, rather than the current time.
The minutely data block will be omitted, unless you are requesting a time within an hour of the present.
The hourly data block will contain data points starting at midnight (local time) of the day requested, and continuing until midnight (local time) of the following day.
The daily data block will contain a single data point referring to the requested date.
The alerts data block will be omitted.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.OptionalParameters.LanguageCode
member.summary:
Return properties in the desired language.
(Note that units in the summary will be set according to the
parameter, so be sure to set both parameters appropriately.).
English is the default, but see the
forecast documentation page
for supported languages.

member.name: P:DarkSky.Models.OptionalParameters.MeasurementUnits
member.summary:
Return weather conditions in the requested units.
US Imperial Units are the default, but see the
forecast documentation page
for supported units.

member.name: T:DarkSky.Models.PrecipitationType
member.summary: Types of precipitation Dark Sky API can return.

member.name: F:DarkSky.Models.PrecipitationType.None
member.summary: An unknown precipitation.

member.name: F:DarkSky.Models.PrecipitationType.Rain
member.summary: Rain.

member.name: F:DarkSky.Models.PrecipitationType.Snow
member.summary: Snow.

member.name: F:DarkSky.Models.PrecipitationType.Sleet
member.summary:
Sleet.
(which refers to each of freezing rain, ice pellets, and “wintery mix”)
